definition: to wash out/elimination (by selection)/natural selection/to knock out (in a competition)/to die out/to phase out

sentences.english: This branch is obsoleted. Engineering resource will no longer be invested on this branch in general.

sentences.english: The playoffs continue in this elimination scheme until a conference champion is crowned.
sentences.chinese: 這種淘汰制一直進行到決出分區的冠軍。

sentences.english: The lowliest place elimination series are the achievements inspection one system.

sentences.english: Now, Hamilton College in Clinton, N.Y., says it will phase out merit scholarships altogether.

sentences.english: One fall-out of tapas is control over nature.

sentences.english: They encourage internal competition as the way to weed out the weakest .
sentences.chinese: 他們鼓勵內部競爭，從而淘汰組織的殘兵敗將。

sentences.english: But the marketplace seems quite efficient at weeding out the losers.
sentences.chinese: 但市場淘汰失敗者的效率好像特別高。

sentences.english: What if we pay the fees for the training but later be kicked out of the crew?

sentences.english: Phase - out product control on material to reach the minimum obsolescence cost.

sentences.english: For a rich, warm setting, hardwood paneling can't be beat.
sentences.chinese: 對於豐富，溫暖的環境，硬木鑲板是不會被淘汰的。

definition: to send off (player for a foul)/to knock out (i.e. to beat in a knock-out tournament)/to eliminate/to call out/to kill off/to pull out of (a competition)/to retire (a runner in baseball)/out (i.e. man out in baseball)
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
to withdraw/to abort/to quit/to log out (computing)
to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
